snippet: Global efforts to all but ban the international trade of caviar from the Caspian Sea have opened enormous opportunities for affordable substitutes from unlikely places in America.
abstract: Global efforts to all but ban the international trade of beluga caviar from Russia's Caspian Sea, where overfishing and pollution have depleted sturgeon populations, have opened enormous opportunities for affordable substitutes from unlikely places in America such as Louisiana; annual American exports of caviar and fish roe increased to 37,712 pounds in 2010 from 5,214 pounds in 2001.
lead_paragraph: Global efforts to all but ban the international trade of caviar from the Caspian Sea have opened enormous opportunities for affordable substitutes from unlikely places in America.

headline.seo: Scarcity of Beluga Caviar Opens the Door for Louisiana
headline.main: A Roe, by Any Other Name
headline.print_headline: A Roe, by Any Other Name
